newsitem.title: USA: Food firm recalls chicken salad in U.S. Northeast.
newsitem.headline: Food firm recalls chicken salad in U.S. Northeast.

text.p: A Massachusetts food firm will voluntarily recall about 5,000 pounds of white chicken salad in the Northeast because some of it was underprocessed, the U.S. Agriculture Department said Friday.
Because of underprocessing, the chicken salad may have the potential to cause serious illness if eaten, the department said.

All 32-ounce containers of "Hans Kissle White Chicken Salad" with "Sell by 6-27" stamped on the lid are being recalled. "P-7573" appears inside the Agriculture Department inspection seal. The salad was made by food processor Hans Kissle, Wilmington, Mass.

The chicken salad was distributed primarily to BJ's stores in Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New York, Rhode Island and Vermont. Some may have gone to other retail stores in the region.

The Agriculture Department urged consumers not to eat the salad and to return it to the store where it was purchased. The food maker notified the government of the problem after discovering some of the product already shipped to stores may have been undercooked.
